item.title: Ride Hailing In Rural America: Like Uber With A Neighborly Feel
item.description: April 17, 2017 - A small startup called Liberty Mobility Now is staking itself as the Uber of rural America. But to find its niche there, it has had to adapt everything from its app to its driver training.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 17, 2017 - A small startup called Liberty Mobility Now is staking itself as the Uber of rural America. But to find its niche there, it has had to adapt everything from its app to its driver training. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/17/524339669/ride-hailing-in-rural-america-like-uber-with-a-neighborly-feel

item.title: At Intel, A Retirement Perk That Can Kick Off A New Career As A Paid Fellow
item.description: April 17, 2017 - The tech company pays retirement-age employees a stipend to transition to jobs with mission-driven nonprofits. And for some, the fellowship can turn into a second act.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 17, 2017 - The tech company pays retirement-age employees a stipend to transition to jobs with mission-driven nonprofits. And for some, the fellowship can turn into a second act. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/17/523772071/at-intel-a-retirement-perk-that-can-kick-off-a-new-career-as-a-paid-fellow

item.title: Selling Your Internet Browsing History
item.description: April 16, 2017 - Last month Congress repealed regulations that would have put hefty restrictions on Internet service providers. So what do these companies know about us and what can they do with that information?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 16, 2017 - Last month Congress repealed regulations that would have put hefty restrictions on Internet service providers. So what do these companies know about us and what can they do with that information? http://www.npr.org/2017/04/16/524177364/selling-your-internet-browsing-history

item.title: Robert Taylor, A Pioneer Of Modern Computing And The Internet, Dies At 85
item.description: April 15, 2017 - Nearly 50 years ago, visionary Bob Taylor channeled his frustrations with inefficient communication methods into launching the personal computer, as well as the forerunner of today's Internet.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 15, 2017 - Nearly 50 years ago, visionary Bob Taylor channeled his frustrations with inefficient communication methods into launching the personal computer, as well as the forerunner of today's Internet. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/15/524139633/robert-taylor-a-pioneer-of-modern-computing-and-the-internet-dies-at-85

item.title: Researchers Find A New Way To Make Water From Thin Air
item.description: April 14, 2017 - The device isn't the first technology that can turn water vapor into drinkable liquid water. But its creators say it uses less power and works in drier conditions â€” the key is something called a MOF.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 14, 2017 - The device isn't the first technology that can turn water vapor into drinkable liquid water. But its creators say it uses less power and works in drier conditions â€” the key is something called a MOF. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/14/523796745/researchers-find-a-new-way-to-make-water-from-thin-air

item.title: Online Video Producers Caught In Struggle Between Advertisers And YouTube
item.description: April 14, 2017 - YouTube has tweaked algorithms to prevent ads from appearing next to objectionable and extremist videos. But the moves have left YouTube content creators earning less money.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 14, 2017 - YouTube has tweaked algorithms to prevent ads from appearing next to objectionable and extremist videos. But the moves have left YouTube content creators earning less money. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/14/523895647/online-video-producers-caught-in-struggle-between-advertisers-and-youtube

item.title: CIA Director Pompeo Denounces WikiLeaks As 'Hostile Intelligence Service'
item.description: April 13, 2017 - After WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange published a defense of his methods in the Washington Post, Pompeo blasted him as a charlatan.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 13, 2017 - After WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange published a defense of his methods in the Washington Post, Pompeo blasted him as a charlatan. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/13/523849965/cia-director-pompeo-denounces-wikileaks-as-hostile-intelligence-service

item.title: OK Google, Burger King Hijacked Your Speakers ... And Failed Pretty Quickly
item.description: April 13, 2017 - The fast-food chain launched an ad Wednesday meant to wake viewers' Google Home speakers and use them for a makeshift promo. Sadly for Burger King, it wasn't long before the ploy hit some speed bumps.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 13, 2017 - The fast-food chain launched an ad Wednesday meant to wake viewers' Google Home speakers and use them for a makeshift promo. Sadly for Burger King, it wasn't long before the ploy hit some speed bumps. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/13/523740193/ok-google-burger-king-hijacked-your-speakers-and-failed-pretty-quickly

item.title: Using 'Sentiment Analysis' To Understand Trump's Tweets
item.description: April 13, 2017 - Planet Money tries to make a program that reads Donald Trump's tweets and then trades stocks. The first step is training the program to interpret the tweets using something called sentiment analysis.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 13, 2017 - Planet Money tries to make a program that reads Donald Trump's tweets and then trades stocks. The first step is training the program to interpret the tweets using something called sentiment analysis. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/13/523709894/using-sentiment-analysis-to-understand-trumps-tweets

item.title: Tech Creates Our Political Echo Chambers. It Might Also Be A Solution
item.description: April 12, 2017 - Social media took a lot of blame for intensifying polarization and partisan acrimony during the presidential campaign. Now some startups and researchers are trying to burst ideological filter bubbles.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 12, 2017 - Social media took a lot of blame for intensifying polarization and partisan acrimony during the presidential campaign. Now some startups and researchers are trying to burst ideological filter bubbles. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/12/522760479/tech-creates-our-political-echo-chambers-it-might-also-be-a-solution

item.title: With Trump's Border Plans, Security And Surveillance Firms Eye Bigger Profits
item.description: April 12, 2017 - Companies touting their wares at an annual border security conference in Texas are more upbeat than usual. The expo features cameras mounted on telescoping poles, spotlight weapons and lots of drones.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 12, 2017 - Companies touting their wares at an annual border security conference in Texas are more upbeat than usual. The expo features cameras mounted on telescoping poles, spotlight weapons and lots of drones. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/04/12/523533985/with-trumps-border-plans-security-and-surveillance-firms-eye-bigger-profits

item.title: Ride-Hailing App Geared Toward Women Debuts In Boston
item.description: April 12, 2017 - A new ride-hailing service in Boston called Safr is aimed at getting female customers and employing female drivers. Some women drivers and passengers felt unsafe using other ride-hailing apps.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 12, 2017 - A new ride-hailing service in Boston called Safr is aimed at getting female customers and employing female drivers. Some women drivers and passengers felt unsafe using other ride-hailing apps. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/12/523533948/ride-hailing-app-geared-toward-women-debuts-in-boston

item.title: More Travelers Entering U.S. Are Being Asked For Their Cellphones And Passwords
item.description: April 11, 2017 - The Department of Homeland Security says such demands aren't routine and represent a fraction of those entering the country.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 11, 2017 - The Department of Homeland Security says such demands aren't routine and represent a fraction of those entering the country. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/11/523313829/more-travelers-are-being-asked-for-their-cellphones-and-passwords-entering-u-s

item.title: Wireless Industry Lobbies Statehouses For Access To 'Street Furniture'
item.description: April 11, 2017 - Instead of soaring towers with antennas on top, future cell sites will adorn power poles and streetlights owned by cities and towns that are wary of turning them over to wireless companies.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 11, 2017 - Instead of soaring towers with antennas on top, future cell sites will adorn power poles and streetlights owned by cities and towns that are wary of turning them over to wireless companies. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/11/522246173/wireless-industry-lobbies-statehouses-for-access-to-street-furniture

item.title: States Introduce New Legislation To Protect Internet Privacy
item.description: April 10, 2017 - A recent move by Congress to strip the Federal Communications Commission of the power to protect Internet privacy has provoked outrage among some, and state legislatures may try to weigh in.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 10, 2017 - A recent move by Congress to strip the Federal Communications Commission of the power to protect Internet privacy has provoked outrage among some, and state legislatures may try to weigh in. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/10/523311405/states-introduce-new-legislation-to-protect-internet-privacy
